org.societies.android.api.cis
Class SocialContract.Communities

java.lang.Object
  org.societies.android.api.cis.SocialContract.Communities
Enclosing class:
SocialContract
public static final class SocialContract.Communities
extends java.lang.Object

Class Communities

Class overview

Constants and helpers for operating on communities.

This is the URI you will use for accessing information about communities. Every community which is accessible from SocialProvider has an entry in this table. You can search for communities using GLOBAL_ID, name etc. You can find information about both of the following:
  • Communities you are a member of or own.
  • All other communities that are registered in directories.
You might have different levels of information for the different types of communities.

Insert

Applications can insert communities that will be confirmed by SyncAdapters. While confirmation pending, GLOBAL_ID will be "pending". Applications will have to provide the following parameters in when inserting:
  • NAME
  • OWNER_ID
  • TYPE
  • DESCRIPTION (optional, will be set to "na" if not provided)
  • ORIGIN
When an application inserts a community, GLOBAL_ID will be set to "pending" by SocialProvider. This has to be changed by a SyncAdapter upon next successful synchronization. The sync adapter then has to write the correct global_id. While a community is pending it will not accept membership or sharing of services. ORIGIN should be set a name that is recognizable by the appropriate SyncAdapter. E.g. a Facebook SyncAdapter will read only those communities that have ORIGIN set to "Facebook". SyncAdapters cannot insert new communities.

Update

Applications can update:
  • NAME
  • TYPE
  • DESCRIPTION
SyncAdapters can update:
  • NAME
  • TYPE
  • DESCRIPTION

Delete

Applications can delete communities. Only communities that belong to the logged-in user can be deleted. When a community is deleted by an application it is only marked as deleted. It is then deleted by the SyncAdapter, which also deletes all the memberships and sharings.
SyncAdapters can only delete communities that are marked for deletion. Deleting a community by a SyncAdapter will also delete all the memberships and sharings for that community.

Query

Applications and SyncAdapters can query for communities using standard query URI or using _ID as the last part of the URI.

Author:
Babak dot Farshchian at sintef dot no
